info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 2:49PM CDT until July 11 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
Ongoing thunderstorms over the area have brought near 2 inches of precipitation over the last two hours across the advisory area. Thunderstorms are expected to continue over the next couple of hours with an additional 1 to 2 inches of rain expected.
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Iowa, including the following county, Fayette.
* WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding and ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 246 PM CDT, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms with water beginning to pond on area roadways. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oelwein, County Roads 3 And W 13 and County Roads 3 And W 33. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
